definition: to raise (animals)/to bring up (children)/to keep (pets)/to support/to give birth

sentences.english: Like a lion cage at feeding time .
sentences.chinese: 象一只狮子笼子在哺养的时间。

sentences.english: You feed the fish once only and monitor the fish eating all the food within 2 mins.
sentences.chinese: 你每天哺养鱼一次和监测鱼能在2分钟内吃所有食物。

sentences.english: Breeding dogs has been a passion for people through many centuries.
sentences.chinese: 几个世纪以来己们将哺养大狗望做一件无豪情的事情。

sentences.english: When I give love to another, I feed my own soul.
sentences.chinese: 给他人献爱之时，我亦哺养了自己的心灵。

sentences.english: From the start there was disagreement over what constituted color feeding.
sentences.chinese: 从一开始有以什么的分歧构成了颜色哺养。

sentences.english: Did we get this far just to feed your hate?
sentences.chinese: 我们是否得到此远哺养您的怨恨？

definition: to feed (a child, domestic animal etc)/to keep/to raise (an animal)
to look after (elderly parents)/to serve/to support
to suffer every possible torment (idiom); bitter hardship/to bear one's cross
to tend/to take care of sb
to give birth to/to give rise to
to bear/to give birth/to grow/to rear/to bring up (children)/fertility
